hanzi-su-wiki:
負

Значения

Нести на себе; быть ответственным, обязанным; терпеть поражение, уступать; побеждать, выигрывать; отрицательный, ниже нуля; нести бремя долгов

Мнемоника

  • Вверху — согнувшийся человек. Он гонится за деньгами 貝.

  • "Потерпевший поражение человек платит деньги."

Варианты

负
purpleculture_pinyin:
fù
to bear; to carry (on one's back); to turn one's back on; to be defeated; negative (math. etc)
нести; носить (на спине); отвернуться; быть побежденным; отрицательный (математика и т. д.)

heisig_chinese_memo: Tied up, the shellfish had to accept being defeated!
heisig_constituent: defeat, bound up, shellfish, clam, oyster, eye, animal legs, eight
heisig_story: Above we have the condensed form of bound up, and below the familiar shellfish. Now imagine two oysters engaged in shell-to-shell combat, the one who is defeated being bound and gagged with seaweed, the victor towering triumphantly over it. The bound shellfish thus becomes the symbol for defeat.
Keyword_KANJIDIC: defeat, negative, -, minus, bear, owe, assume a responsibility
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: поражение, отрицательное - минус, медведь, обязаны, взять на себя ответственность
koohiiStory1: Tied up, the shellfish had to accept defeat!
koohiiStory2: Defeat is defined by a shellfish in binds.
jp_example_words:
負う(おう): to bear, to owe
御負け(おまけ): a discount, a prize, something additional, bonus, an extra, an exaggeration
背負う(しょう): to be burdened with, to carry on back or shoulder
勝負(しょうぶ): victory or defeat, match, contest, game, bout
負債(ふさい): debt, liabilities
負傷(ふしょう): injury, wound
負担(ふたん): burden, charge, responsibility
負かす(まかす): to defeat
背負う(せおう): be burdened with, carry on back or shoulder
負け(まけ): defeat, loss, losing (a game)
負ける(まける): lose
jp_readingExamples: 負う (お.う), 負かす (ま.かす), 負ける (ま.ける)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: When you're in prison, whoever ends up with the shellfish will lose. It's the game all prisoners play. It's like keep away from the shellfish. And if you end up with the shellfish BZZZZTT that's it, you're the loser.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine that it's your first day in prison. You're walking around the yard, minding your own business, when suddenly a shellfish smacks you right in the head and falls into your open hands. "HAHA YOU LOSE!" someone shouts.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: If you lose, you're a fool (ふ). All you had to do was not hold the prison shellfish. It really shouldn't have been that hard to not lose, ya fool.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Now you have to try to make some other fool lose. Otherwise you'll be the loser fool forever.
Ru_Meaning: defeat, negative, -, minus, bear, owe, assume a responsibility

Ru_trainchinese:
fù: (глаг/прил) брать на себя, нести; подвергаться; проигрывать, терпеть неудачу; быть должным, задолжать; (матем.) минус; (электр.) отрицательный
fù: (графема) нести (на спине); полагаться на, опираться на; пользоваться (напр., славой); предавать, нарушать
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the shellfish (貝) uses his corner (⺈) to defeat
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Bound up by seaweed the shellfish had to accept being defeated.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " person " to " shell ", it means carrying things on your back. "Shuowen": "Reliance. From the people to keep the shells, there is some reliance. One said: the loan is not paid." "Poetry‧Xiaoya‧No Sheep": "Er Mu comes to think, He Bin He Li, or Take it."

" Negative " can mean to bear and bear. "Zhuangzi·Xiaoyaoyou": "The accumulation of wind is not strong, and its negative wings are also weak."

" Negative " also means what is carried and what is assumed. "Guliang Chuan-Twenty-Nine Years of Zhaogong": "Zhaogong went to run, and the people were relieved.

" Negative " also means to rely on. "Ritual-Shi Funeral": "Sit on the west side, order the tortoise to prosper, teach the tortoise, and bear the east."

" Negative " also means betrayal and betrayal. "Warring States Policy‧Qin Policy Five": "On the day of losing Qin, the prince is a dung!"

" Negative " also refers to defeat or defeat. "Sun Tzu Mou Gong": "I don't know the enemy but know myself, one win and one loss."

" Negative " also means to hold and enjoy. Sima Qian of the Han Dynasty (Report to Ren Shaoqing): "The servants bear the unruly trip, and the reputation of the song of no country is long."

" Negative " also means entanglement and drag. "Book of Jin-Shu Xi Biography": "One person misses class and loses the counties and counties. This manpower can be caused."
humanum_short_description_en: From " person ", from " shell ", which means carrying things on their backs.
humanum_full_description:
從「人」，從「貝」，表示以背載物。《說文》：「恃也。从人守貝，有所恃也。一曰：受貸不償。」《詩‧小雅‧無羊》：「爾牧來思，何蓑何笠，或負其餱。」

　　「負」可表示承受、擔負。《莊子‧逍遙游》：「風之積也不厚，則其負大翼也無力。」

　　「負」也表示所背之物、所承擔者。《穀梁傳‧昭公二十九年》：「昭公出奔，民如釋重負。」

　　「負」還表示倚靠。《儀禮‧士喪禮》：「西面坐，命龜興，授卜人龜，負東扉。」

　　「負」亦表示背棄、辜負。《戰國策‧秦策五》：「負秦之日，太子為糞矣！」

　　「負」也指戰敗、失敗。《孫子‧謀攻》：「不知彼而知己，一勝一負。」

　　「負」也表示抱有、享有。漢司馬遷〈報任少卿書〉：「僕少負不羈之行，長無鄉曲之譽。」

　　「負」還表示連累、拖累。《晉書‧束晰傳》：「一人失課，負及郡縣，此人力之可致也。」
humanum_short_description: 從「人」，從「貝」，表示以背載物。

Ideographic: A person 人 carrying a lot of money 貝
  • ⿱ Above to below
    • ⺈
    • 貝 [ bèi ] sea shell; money, currency
①馱，背(baō)：負米。負疚。負重。如釋重負。負荊請罪。
②擔任：擔負。負責。負累(l噄)。負罪。負荷。忍辱負重。身負重任。
③仗恃，依靠：負隅頑抗。自負(自以爲了不起)。
④遭受：負傷。負屈。
⑤具有，享有：久負盛譽。
⑥欠(錢)：負債。
⑦小於零的(數)，與“正”相對：負數。
⑧指相對的兩方面中反的一面，與“正”相對：負電。負極。
⑨違背，背棄：負心。負約。忘恩負義。
⑩失敗，與“勝”相對：不分勝負。
負責 [ fù zé ]: to be in charge of; to take responsibility for; to be to blame; conscientious
負責人 [ fù zé rén ]: person in charge
負擔 [ fù dān ]: burden; to bear a burden

從「 人 」，從「 貝 」，表示以背載物。《說文》：「恃也。从人守貝，有所恃也。一曰：受貸不償。」《詩‧小雅‧無羊》：「爾牧來思，何蓑何笠，或負其餱。」 「 負 」可表示承受、擔負。《莊子‧逍遙游》：「風之積也不厚，則其負大翼也無力。」 「 負 」也表示所背之物、所承擔者。《穀梁傳‧昭公二十九年》：「昭公出奔，民如釋重負。」 「 負 」還表示倚靠。《儀禮‧士喪禮》：「西面坐，命龜興，授卜人龜，負東扉。」 「 負 」亦表示背棄、辜負。《戰國策‧秦策五》：「負秦之日，太子為糞矣！」 「 負 」也指戰敗、失敗。《孫子‧謀攻》：「不知彼而知己，一勝一負。」 「 負 」也表示抱有、享有。漢司馬遷〈報任少卿書〉：「僕少負不羈之行，長無鄉曲之譽。」 「 負 」還表示連累、拖累。《晉書‧束晰傳》：「一人失課，負及郡縣，此人力之可致也。」
From " person" to " shell", it means carrying things on your back. "Shuowen": "Reliance. From the people to keep the shells, there is some reliance. One said: the loan is not paid." "Poetry‧Xiaoya‧No Sheep": "Er Mu comes to think, He Bin He Li, or Take it." " Negative" can mean to bear and bear. "Zhuangzi·Xiaoyaoyou": "The accumulation of wind is not strong, and its negative wings are also weak." " Negative" also means what is carried and what is assumed. "Guliang Chuan-Twenty-Nine Years of Zhaogong": "Zhaogong went to run, and the people were relieved. " Negative" also means to rely on. "Ritual-Shi Funeral": "Sit on the west side, order the tortoise to prosper, teach the tortoise, and bear the east." " Negative" also means betrayal and betrayal. "Warring States Policy‧Qin Policy Five": "On the day of losing Qin, the prince is a dung!" " Negative" also refers to defeat or defeat. "Sun Tzu Mou Gong": "I don't know the enemy but know myself, one win and one loss." " Negative" also means to hold and enjoy. Sima Qian of the Han Dynasty (Report to Ren Shaoqing): "The servants bear the unruly trip, and the reputation of the song of no country is long." " Negative" also means entanglement and drag. "Book of Jin-Shu Xi Biography": "One person misses class and loses the counties and counties. This manpower can be caused."

負字的基本解释

負
fù
见“负”。

負字的汉语字典释义

[①]［fù］
［《廣韻》房九切，上有，奉。］
“负1”的繁体字。
(1)以背载物。
(2)承受；担负。
(3)谓加，使承受。
(4)所背之物；所承担者。
(5)抱持。
(6)抱有；享有。
(7)遭受；蒙受。
(8)连累；拖累。
(9)依，倚靠。
(10)依恃；凭借。
(11)背弃；辜负。
(12)反背。
(13)战败；失败。
(14)亏欠；拖欠。
(15)债务。
(16)赔偿；补偿。
(17)罪责；过失。
(18)惭愧；抱愧。
(19)忧虑。
(20)犹洑。游水；泅水。参见“負流”。
(21)古制丧服的一部分。指披在肩背上的粗麻片。
(22)中医术语。指称脉象相互克贼。
(23)古代天文术语。
(24)与“正”相对。数学上指小于零的；物理学上指得到电子的。
(25)通“倍”。
(26)通“掊”。敲打。
(27)通“孚”。孵育。
(28)通“媍”。老妇人。
(29)通“伏”

負字的康熙字典解释

【酉集中】【貝字部】　負； 康熙笔画：9； 页码：页1204第06
【唐韻】房久切【集韻】【韻會】扶缶切，?音婦。【說文】恃也。从人守貝，有所恃也。【史記·魏其武安侯傳】武安負貴而好權。　又【說文】一曰受貸不償。【前漢·鄧通傳】通家尚負責數鉅萬。　又【釋名】負，背也。置項背也。【玉篇】擔也。或作偩。【廣韻】荷也。【易·解卦】負且乗，致?至。【詩·大雅】是任是負。【左傳·莊二十年】弛於負擔。　又背也。【禮·明堂位】天子負斧，依南鄕而立。【註】負之言背也。　又依也。【孟子】虎負嵎。【趙岐註】虎依嵎而怒。　又失也。【戰國策】公負令秦與强齊戰。【註】負，猶失也。　又老母之稱。【史記·高祖紀】常從王媼、武負貰酒。【漢書註】如淳曰：俗謂老大母爲阿負。師古曰：《列女傳》云魏曲沃負者，魏大夫如耳之母也。古語謂老母爲負耳。　又敗也。【史記·?丞相世家】無益於勝負之數。【孫子·攻謀篇】一勝一負。　又憂也。【後漢·章帝紀】刺史二千石不爲負。【註】負，猶憂也。　又愧也。【後漢·張步傳】負負無可言。【註】負，愧也。　又【廣韻】背恩忘德曰負

Traditional characters of "负1".
(1) Carry things on your back.
(2) To bear; to bear.
(3) We say to add, make to bear.
(4) What is carried; what is assumed.
(5) Hold.
(6) To hold; to enjoy.
(7) Suffer; suffer.
(8) Involved; dragged down.
(9) Rely on, rely on.
(10) Relying on; relying on.
(11) Betrayal; let down.
(12) Reverse the back.
(13) Defeat; defeat.
(14) In arrears; in arrears.
(15) Debt.
(16) Compensation; compensation.
(17) Guilt; Negligence.
(18) Ashamed; ashamed.
(19) Worry.
(20) Still faint. Swim; swim. See "negative flow".
(21) Part of the ancient mourning dress. Refers to the hemp piece that is draped over the shoulders.
(22) TCM terminology. Alleged that the pulse condition suppresses each other.
(23) Ancient astronomical terms.
(24) Opposite to "positive". Mathematically refers to the one that is less than zero; physics refers to the one that gets electrons.
(25) Through "times."
(26) Through "掊". beat.
(27) Link "Fu". Incubate.
(28) Through "媍". Old woman.
(29) Through "Volt"

Name meaning

fù
вм. 负

負

Значения

Нести на себе; быть ответственным, обязанным; терпеть поражение, уступать; побеждать, выигрывать; отрицательный, ниже нуля; нести бремя долгов

Мнемоника

  • Вверху — согнувшийся человек. Он гонится за деньгами 貝.

  • "Потерпевший поражение человек платит деньги."

Варианты

负

Radicals: 勹, 貝  (prison, shellfish)
Meaning Mnemonic
When you're in prison, whoever ends up with the shellfish will lose. It's the game all prisoners play. It's like keep away from the shellfish. And if you end up with the shellfish BZZZZTT that's it, you're the loser.
Imagine that it's your first day in prison. You're walking around the yard, minding your own business, when suddenly a shellfish smacks you right in the head and falls into your open hands. "HAHA YOU LOSE!" someone shouts.
Reading Mnemonic
If you lose, you're a fool (ふ). All you had to do was not hold the prison shellfish. It really shouldn't have been that hard to not lose, ya fool.
Now you have to try to make some other fool lose. Otherwise you'll be the loser fool forever.

負けるまける
  • терпеть поражение, проигрывать
  • уступать, поддаваться

  • получить (напр. ранение)
  • быть обязанным кому-л
    • warodai
